t: Matthew 26
And*p it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples,
Ye*rp know*r that*r after*r two*r days*r is*r the*r feast*r of*r the*r passover,*r and*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r betrayed*r to*r be*r crucified.*r
Then*p assembled together the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders of the people, unto the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,
And*p consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty, and kill him.
But*p they said, Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar among the people.
Now*p when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,
There*p came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment, and poured it on his head, as he sat at meat.
But*p when his disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, To what purpose is this waste?
For*p this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.
When*p Jesus understood it, he said unto them, Why*r trouble*r ye*r the*r woman?*r for*r she*r hath*r wrought*r a*r good*r work*r upon*r me.*r
For*rp ye*r have*r the*r poor*r always*r with*r you;*r but*r me*r ye*r have*r not*r always.*r
For*rp in*r that*r she*r hath*r poured*r this*r ointment*r on*r my*r body,*r she*r did*r it*r for*r my*r burial.*r

Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Wheresoever*r this*r gospel*r shall*r be*r preached*r in*r the*r whole*r world,*r there*r shall*r also*r this,*r that*r this*r woman*r hath*r done,*r be*r told*r for*r a*r memorial*r of*r her.*r
Then*p one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests,
And*p said unto them, What will ye give me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver.
And*p from that time he sought opportunity to betray him.
Now*p the first day of the feast of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover?

And*p he said, Go*r into*r the*r city*r to*r such*r a*r man,*r and*r say*r unto*r him,*r The*r Master*r saith,*r My*r time*r is*r at*r hand;*r I*r will*r keep*r the*r passover*r at*r thy*r house*r with*r my*r disciples.*r
And*p the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them; and they made ready the passover.
Now*p when the even was come, he sat down with the twelve.
And*p as they did eat, he said, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r that*r one*r of*r you*r shall*r betray*r me.*r
And*p they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto him, Lord, is it I?
And*p he answered and said, He*r that*r dippeth*r his*r hand*r with*r me*r in*r the*r dish,*r the*r same*r shall*r betray*r me.*r

The*rp Son*r of*r man*r goeth*r as*r it*r is*r written*r of*r him:*r but*r woe*r unto*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r betrayed!*r it*r had*r been*r good*r for*r that*r man*r if*r he*r had*r not*r been*r born.*r
Then*p Judas, which betrayed him, answered and said, Master, is it I? He said unto him, Thou*r hast*r said.*r
And*p as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and blessed it, and brake it, and gave it to the disciples, and said, Take,*r eat;*r this*r is*r my*r body.*r
And*p he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, Drink*r ye*r all*r of*r it;*r
For*rp this*r is*r my*r blood*r of*r the*r new*r testament,*r which*r is*r shed*r for*r many*r for*r the*r remission*r of*r sins.*r

But*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r I*r will*r not*r drink*r henceforth*r of*r this*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine,*r until*r that*r day*r when*r I*r drink*r it*r new*r with*r you*r in*r my*r Father's*r kingdom.*r
And*p when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.

Then*p saith Jesus unto them, All*r ye*r shall*r be*r offended*r because*r of*r me*r this*r night:*r for*r it*r is*r written,*r I*r will*r smite*r the*r shepherd,*r and*r the*r sheep*r of*r the*r flock*r shall*r be*r scattered*r abroad.*r
But*rp after*r I*r am*r risen*r again,*r I*r will*r go*r before*r you*r into*r Galilee.*r
Peter*p answered and said unto him, Though all men shall be offended because of thee, yet will I never be offended.
Jesus*p said unto him, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r That*r this*r night,*r before*r the*r cock*r crow,*r thou*r shalt*r deny*r me*r thrice.*r
Peter*p said unto him, Though I should die with thee, yet will I not deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.
Then*p cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and saith unto the disciples, Sit*r ye*r here,*r while*r I*r go*r and*r pray*r yonder.*r
And*p he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and very heavy.
Then*p saith he unto them, My*r soul*r is*r exceeding*r sorrowful,*r even*r unto*r death:*r tarry*r ye*r here,*r and*r watch*r with*r me.*r

And*p he went a little further, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying, O*r my*r Father,*r if*r it*r be*r possible,*r let*r this*r cup*r pass*r from*r me:*r nevertheless*r not*r as*r I*r will,*r but*r as*r thou*r wilt.*r
And*p he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them asleep, and saith unto Peter, What,*r could*r ye*r not*r watch*r with*r me*r one*r hour?*r
Watch*rp and*r pray,*r that*r ye*r enter*r not*r into*r temptation:*r the*r spirit*r indeed*r is*r willing,*r but*r the*r flesh*r is*r weak.*r
He*p went away again the second time, and prayed, saying, O*r my*r Father,*r if*r this*r cup*r may*r not*r pass*r away*r from*r me,*r except*r I*r drink*r it,*r thy*r will*r be*r done.*r
And*p he came and found them asleep again: for their eyes were heavy.
And*p he left them, and went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.

Then*p cometh he to his disciples, and saith unto them, Sleep*r on*r now,*r and*r take*r your*r rest:*r behold,*r the*r hour*r is*r at*r hand,*r and*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinners.*r
Rise,*rp let*r us*r be*r going:*r behold,*r he*r is*r at*r hand*r that*r doth*r betray*r me.*r
And*p while he yet spake, lo, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.
Now*p he that betrayed him gave them a sign, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he: hold him fast.
And*p forthwith he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, master; and kissed him.
And*p Jesus said unto him, Friend,*r wherefore*r art*r thou*r come?*r Then came they, and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.
And,*p behold, one of them which were with Jesus stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest's, and smote off his ear.
Then*p said Jesus unto him, Put*r up*r again*r thy*r sword*r into*r his*r place:*r for*r all*r they*r that*r take*r the*r sword*r shall*r perish*r with*r the*r sword.*r
Thinkest*rp thou*r that*r I*r cannot*r now*r pray*r to*r my*r Father,*r and*r he*r shall*r presently*r give*r me*r more*r than*r twelve*r legions*r of*r angels?*r
But*rp how*r then*r shall*r the*r scriptures*r be*r fulfilled,*r that*r thus*r it*r must*r be?*r

In*p that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes, Are*r ye*r come*r out*r as*r against*r a*r thief*r with*r swords*r and*r staves*r for*r to*r take*r me?*r I*r sat*r daily*r with*r you*r teaching*r in*r the*r temple,*r and*r ye*r laid*r no*r hold*r on*r me.*r
But*rp all*r this*r was*r done,*r that*r the*r scriptures*r of*r the*r prophets*r might*r be*r fulfilled.*r Then all the disciples forsook him, and fled.
And*p they that had laid hold on Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.
But*p Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest's palace, and went in, and sat with the servants, to see the end.
Now*p the chief priests, and elders, and all the council, sought false witness against Jesus, to put him to death;
But*p found none: yea, though many false witnesses came, yet found they none. At the last came two false witnesses,
And*p said, This fellow said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.
And*p the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?
But*p Jesus held his peace. And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.

Jesus*p saith unto him, Thou*r hast*r said:*r nevertheless*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Hereafter*r shall*r ye*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r sitting*r on*r the*r right*r hand*r of*r power,*r and*r coming*r in*r the*r clouds*r of*r heaven.*r
Then*p the high priest rent his clothes, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy; what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy.
What*p think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.
Then*p did they spit in his face, and buffeted him; and others smote him with the palms of their hands,
Saying,*p Prophesy unto us, thou Christ, Who is he that smote thee?
Now*p Peter sat without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee.
But*p he denied before them all, saying, I know not what thou sayest.
And*p when he was gone out into the porch, another maid saw him, and said unto them that were there, This fellow was also with Jesus of Nazareth.
And*p again he denied with an oath, I do not know the man.
And*p after a while came unto him they that stood by, and said to Peter, Surely thou also art one of them; for thy speech bewrayeth thee.
Then*p began he to curse and to swear, saying, I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.
And*p Peter remembered the word of Jesus, which said unto him, Before*r the*r cock*r crow,*r thou*r shalt*r deny*r me*r thrice.*r And he went out, and wept bitterly.
